name: Native species presence
functionStatement: Species interactions sustain biodiversity, restrain invasives, and build resilience to disturbance.
descriptionMarkdown: Most historically native fish/inverts remain, unless naturally low-diversity (headwaters, ephemeral).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compare observed fish and invertebrate lists to available historical records or reference expectations.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Only tolerant or non native species observed.
Criteria: Natives rare or absent. Community dominated by tolerant or invasive taxa.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Many sensitive natives gone. Non natives frequent.
Criteria: Noticeable native decline. Non natives common or co-dominant.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Most natives present. Some sensitive species missing.
Criteria: Minor native loss. Non natives present but natives still dominant.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Native fish and invertebrates common. Very few non natives seen.
Criteria: Native community matches reference. Non natives rare and low abundance.

references: state Natural Heritage Program lists and records.
